item.content:encoded:
1, 2, 1, 2… I was at my first boxing session, and all I had to do was practice the six basic punches: jabs, hooks, and uppercuts (front and rear for all of them). The same motion, over and over again…

Some might get bored of it, and some might get tired. I’ve felt both of those at the same time. Yet I did it and listened to all of the corrections my coach gave me. I felt great because I knew I had started a process. A process that will make me a fighter in the end.

Whenever you feel like giving up learning a skill because you’re exhausted or unmotivated, keep going. It’s going to be very rewarding.

At the same time, sometimes you’ll have to realize you wasted time learning something unnecessary. Pivot is unavoidable.

Some might consider you a hypocrite for changing your opinion. Remember, you’re a free agent. You control your state of mind. You’ll have the humility to know when a change is needed.

P.S.: After my first session, all of my sleeping problems disappeared. Weight training alone isn’t enough. Get some cardio in, too.
